definition: to tap/to knock (against sth hard)/to knock (mud from boots, ashes from a pipe etc)
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)
to knock against/to bump into/to have a disagreement/to clash
lit. to kowtow like grinding garlic (idiom)/fig. to pound the ground with one's head

sentences.english: Men have got together to knock a ball around for thousands of years.
sentences.chinese: 男人在一起磕了千百年來球左右。

sentences.english: The bottom of the bucket is clean knocked cut.
sentences.chinese: 水桶底兒一古腦兒地都磕掉了。

sentences.english: He Junfeng above knelt down to give him upon his head, then blew up his house.
sentences.chinese: 賀俊峯上面跪下來給他磕了頭，然後引爆了他的房子。

sentences.english: Evening my sister came back for a night of knock chatter .
sentences.chinese: 傍晚姐姐回來嘮了一晚上的磕。

sentences.english: My head bumped against the doorframe.
Go now! That man happily made several more kowtows and left.
sentences.chinese: 那人高高興興地又磕了幾個頭，這纔去了。

sentences.english: He that will have the kernel, must crack the shell.
sentences.chinese: 得到果核的人必須先磕開殼。

sentences.english: What attracts the tourists most is people in the street.
sentences.chinese: 最引入注目的是在街上磕長頭的人們。

sentences.english: He bumped into a wall and a swelling appeared immediately on his head.
sentences.chinese: 他把頭磕在了牆上，頭上起了一個鼓包。

sentences.english: That year , I prayed and crawled along the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 那一年，磕長頭匍匐在山麓。

sentences.english: He tapped the ashes out of the pipe.
sentences.chinese: 他把菸灰從菸斗裏磕出來。

sentences.english: Andy stumbles against the MAN in front of him, almost drags him down.
sentences.chinese: 安迪與他前面的人磕拌了一下，差點拽倒了那個人。

sentences.english: They knock balls about in sports fields, parks, wasteland and in other places.
sentences.chinese: 他們對球磕在體育領域，公園，荒地和其他地方。

sentences.english: Want the look of a digital watch with the cachet of a classical timepiece?
sentences.chinese: 想看磕暌剮經典優異標識表記標幟的數字電子手錶嗎？

sentences.english: My dad smiles and taps on his pipe.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸微笑着磕了磕他的菸斗。

sentences.english: My dad smiles and taps on his pipe.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸微笑着磕了磕他的菸斗。

definition: to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
to bump one's head/to kowtow with head-banging on the ground
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
